channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NC
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NC

item.title: Report X-2023110047
item.description:
Report X-2023110047

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-21T18:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-19
  • City: KERNERSVILLE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: THERE WAS A BOX FOUND ON THE DOCK, WITH THE OUTER PART OF IT WET. IT WAS PLACED IN A HAZMAT BAG AND DRUM. THEN, PLACED BY THE HAZMAT CAGE. DescribePack: THE LID CAME LOOSE ON ONE OF THE 2 GALLON PLASTIC BOTTLES. THE CORNER OF THE PACKAGE WAS WET. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PUT IN A PLASTIC BAG AND DRUM.

item.title: Report X-2023101397
item.description:
Report X-2023101397

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-21T18:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-19
  • City: NEWTON
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package found in unload area staged for qa at approximately 5:00am. QA-HAZMAT outer packaging is wet from internal leakage. Liquid from hazmat was absorbed into outer packaging. No packages damaged by hazmat. DescribePack: Side of fiberboard box is wet due to internal leakage. Four of four plastic 1 gallon isopropyl alcohol bottles have loose caps causing 2oz of liquid to leak into packaging. outer packaging absorbed leakage and left packaging stained and wet. No internal packaging was found inside of package to prevent damage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a hazmat plastic bag and into a red hazmat tote to prevent spillage onto other packages.

item.title: Report X-2023101376
item.description:
Report X-2023101376

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-21T18:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-18
  • City: KERNERSVILLE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: THE PACKAGE WAS FOUND ON THE DOCK WITH A WET EXTERIOR BOX. IT WAS BROUGHT OVER TO THE HAZMAT CAGE FOR EVALUATION. DescribePack: 1 PLASTIC BOTTLE, THE LID WAS LOOSE. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: WAS BROUGHT OVER TO THE HAZMAT CAGE AND MADE US AWARE IT WAS HERE. WE GOT A BAG TO PLACE IT IN, THEN A DRUM.

item.title: Report X-2023101368
item.description:
Report X-2023101368

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-21T18:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-18
  • City: CHARLOTTE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Liquid in bottles leaked through seal causing cardboard to give out due to weight. DescribePack: Added seal for bottles failed as liquid leak through. DurationRel: -30 and MitigateEffect: package was immediately placed in a lined tote and taken to HazMat processing area.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was brought to QA in a tote for further investigation from the unload side DescribePack: The container inside the package was broken DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed inside of a tote to prevent any more leakage

item.title: Report X-2023101143
item.description:
Report X-2023101143

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-21T18:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-13
  • City: GREENSBORO
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RMP DISCOVERED PACKAGE LEAKING ON AN INBOUND LOAD. RESPONDER DONNED PPE AND USED SPILL CART, DECISION TREE RESPONSE SHEETS TO IDENTIFY THE CONTENTS AND CLEAN THE SPILL. RESPONDER REMOVED THE LEAKER TO THE DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.
